resources.string: Search and select the node on your paddle:
Search and select the node on the front paddler\'s paddle:

The sensors can be switched on by pressing once on the button located on the middle of the sensor.

If it is on, it will blink with a blue light.

If it is blinking with a red light, its battery is below 10%.

 If it is pulsating, it is already connected.
1. Make sure the sensors to be used are switched on.\n
2. Press START. Read How To Use The Sensors for further instructions on how to turn on the sensors.\n
3. Press SEARCH IMU-SENSOR and activate Bluetooth if prompted. Press on the sensor that is mounted on your paddle. \n
4. Press SEARCH IMU-SENSOR. Press on the sensor that is mounted on the paddle of the front paddler.\n
How To Interpret The Feedback System\n\n

As feedback, you\'ll receive different type of feedback depending on your synchronisation level. You will receive both visual and auditive feedback. There are three different synchronisation levels, 1, 2 and 3.\n
In synchronisation level 1, you have achieved full synchronisation with the front paddler. The screen will then be coloured in green and you will hear a single beep during a stroke.\n

In synchronisation level 2, you are a little behind achieving full synchronisation with the front paddler. The screen will then be coloured in yellow and you will hear a two beeps, with the second one directly after the first, during a stroke.\n

In synchronisation level 3, you are far behind achieving full synchronisation with the front paddler. The screen will then be coloured in red and you will hear a three beeps, with the second one directly after the first and the third directly after the second, during a stroke.\n
The max time difference in milliseconds which will be accepted in order to reach synchronisation level 1.
The max time difference in milliseconds which will be accepted in order to reach synchronisation level 2.
Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history
